summary: This document contains excerpts from the April 22, 2016, and July 22, 2016, depositions of Ghislaine Maxwell in a civil case. The questioning focuses on her knowledge of underage girls at Jeffrey Epstein's properties, her role in inviting or interacting with them, and her awareness of sexual activities and paraphernalia. Maxwell repeatedly denies knowledge or involvement, with her attorney objecting frequently.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual being deposed. She is questioned extensively about her knowledge of underage girls at Jeffrey Epstein's properties, her role in inviting them, and her awareness of sexual activities. She repeatedly denies knowledge or involvement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the deposition. Questions revolve around whether underage girls were invited to his homes for massages and whether he engaged in sexual activities with them. Maxwell describes him as a friend.

persons.name: Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who repeatedly objects to the form and foundation of questions during her deposition.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Referred to indirectly as a person who claims to have been a masseuse. Maxwell discusses her age and her mother's friendship with Epstein.

connections.description: Maxwell was present at Epstein's homes and describes knowing his friends. She testifies about her own sexual activities with him.
Pagliuca acts as Maxwell's defense attorney during the deposition, objecting to numerous questions.
Maxwell states she met Giuffre, that Giuffre and her mother were friends of Epstein, and that Giuffre may have been in Epstein's house.
Maxwell describes Giuffre and her mother as friends of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Maxwell Deposition (First Session)
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is deposed in a civil case. She is questioned about inviting underage girls to Epstein's homes, her knowledge of underage masseuses, and when she met Virginia Giuffre.

events.title: Maxwell Deposition (Second Session)
events.description: Follow-up deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell. Questioning focuses on her knowledge of Epstein securing non-professional masseuses, the presence of sex toys at his properties, and her own sexual activities.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's property in the Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell testified under oath that she was not aware of inviting any underage females, other than children of her friends, to Jeffrey Epstein's homes.
Maxwell stated that during the time she was present at Epstein's properties, the people who gave him massages were adults over the age of 18.
When asked about Virginia Giuffre, Maxwell claimed to have no idea how old Giuffre was when they met or if she was under 18, and described Giuffre and her mother as friends of Epstein.
Maxwell denied ever having conversations intended to convince anyone to engage in sexual activities with Jeffrey Epstein.
Maxwell testified she was not aware of the presence of sex toys or devices used in sexual activities in any of Epstein's properties.
